meanings.definition: To cover or line with a ceiling.
meanings.sent1: The builders ceiled the room with white panels.
meanings.sent2: They always make sure to ceil the top of the house properly.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to ceil its bed with a blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness ceiled her heart like a warm blanket.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to ceil the entire sky, blocking out the sun.

meanings.sent1: The company ceiled the employees with a bonus at the end of the year.
meanings.sent2: It is important to ceil the budget to avoid overspending.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to ceil the audience with a surprise trick.
meanings.sent4: The love and care of the family ceil the child's world with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The artist's talent seemed to ceil the painting with life.

meanings.definition: To cover with or as if with a ceiling.
meanings.sent1: The decorators ceiled the ballroom with elegant fabric.
meanings.sent2: The architect decided to ceil the entire building with glass.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to ceil the dessert with a layer of chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to ceil the night sky with their twinkling light.
meanings.sent5: The fog began to ceil the valley, creating a mystical atmosphere.
